comment.author: 59337687@N05
comment._content: I believe the boat to be "The Lady Wright", which was commisioned by my father for the river Gambia in the late 1940s. My late father, L.G. Culshaw was then Director of Public Works and Controller of Civil Aviation for the gambia Colony, as it then was. He worked for the Colonial Engineering Service in Nigeria, Cameroon and Gambia from 1927 to 1950, building roads briges, drainage and water systems all over those countries. I have a number of his photos from this period.
